rtega_mnemonic:
哥哥RSelder brother
  • the brother who is twice as good 可可 as all other brothers
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: One person talking 可 over another 可
purpleculture_examples:
大哥 [ dà gē ]: eldest brother; big brother (polite address for a man of about the same age as oneself); gang leader; boss
表哥 [ biǎo gē ]: older male cousin via female line
八哥 [ bā gē ]: (bird species of China) crested myna (Acridotheres cristatellus)
老大哥 [ lǎo dà gē ]: big brother
帅哥 [ shuài gē ]: handsome guy; lady-killer; handsome (form of address)

Ru_trainchinese: gē: (сущ) старший брат; брат (обращение к двоюродному брату или зятю); брат (неформальное обращение к старшему лицу мужского пола)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: two times as good (可) is your elder brother (singing a song)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The older brother is always asking his parents if he can do this and do that.
humanum_full_description_en:
from the second " may ", " Ge ancient word" of. "Shuowen": "Brother, sound. From Erke. Ancient Chinese thought the word "謌"." Duan Yucai's note: "Sound also. This meaning has no use. Now I call my brother my brother.... Han Shu often uses brother as a song "See " Song ". "Song Shu‧ Le Zhiyi": "The former Han Dynasty had a father-in-law, good brother, can make Liang Shangchen up."

" Brother " often refers to the elder brother who is the same parent, half-parent, or half-brother. Tang Bai Juyi "Memorial to Brother Fuliang": "Kneel and lay my eldest brother in front of your seat. Brother Fuwei is filial and kind and courteous." " Brother " is used to indicate that the brother is a borrowed foreign language, which is related to ancient Xianbei language etc. Wang Li, Zhao Wengong).

" Brother " is also used as a honorific or nickname for men who are close to him. "Awakening the World Marriage Biography" Chapter 50: "If old buddies ask for the name and beauty of this elder brother for others, how much do you want to thank?"
humanum_short_description_en: From the two " may ", " Ge ancient word", the often expressed call for his brother with their parents or half, of half-.
humanum_full_description:
從二「可」，「謌」之古字。《說文》：「哥，聲也。从二可。古文以爲謌字。」段玉裁注：「聲也。此義未見用者。今呼兄爲哥。……漢書多用哥爲歌。」參見「歌」。《宋書‧樂志一》：「前漢有虞公者，善哥，能令梁上塵起。」

　　「哥」常表示對同父母或同父異母、同母異父的兄長的稱呼。唐白居易〈祭浮梁大兄〉：「再拜跪奠大哥于座前。伏惟哥孝友慈惠，和易謙恭。」「哥」用以表示兄長屬外來語借入，與古鮮卑語等相關（參王力、趙文工）。

　　「哥」亦用作對與自己年齡相近的男子的尊稱或昵稱。《醒世姻緣傳》第50回：「如老哥們替人討這廩生名色，約要多少謝禮？」
humanum_short_description: 從二「可」，「謌」之古字，常表示對同父母或同父異母、同母異父的兄長的稱呼。

哥字的基本解释

哥
gē
兄，同父母（或只同父，只同母）或同族同辈而年龄比自己大的男子：哥哥。
称呼年龄跟自己差不多的男子：李二哥。
古同“歌”。

哥字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gē］
［《廣韻》古俄切，平歌，見。］
(1)“歌”的古字。
(2)对同父母或同父异母、同母异父的兄长的称呼。
(3)对同族中兄长的称呼。
(4)对亲戚中兄长的称呼。
(5)对与自己年龄相近的男子的尊称或昵称。
(6)特指女子对所爱的男子的称呼。
(7)唐代常称父为哥。
(8)语气词。相当于“啊”、“呵”。
(9)宋代著名瓷窑“哥窑”的简称。

哥字的英文翻译

◎ 哥
elder brother

哥字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　哥； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页190第08
【唐韻】古俄切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】居何切，?音牁。【說文】聲也。从二可，古文以爲謌字。【廣韻】古歌字。【前漢·藝文志】哥永言。【唐書·劉禹錫傳】屈原作九哥。　又【廣韻】今呼爲兄。【韻會】潁川語，小曰哥，今人以配姐字，爲兄弟之稱。　又哥舒，複姓。

哥字的源字形

哥字的起名意思

兄，同父母或同辈而年龄比自己大的男子。

brother
Basic explanation of words
brother
gē
Brother, a man with the same parents (or only the same father, only the same mother) or the same generation but older than himself: brother.
Address a man about the same age as you: Brother Li.
Gu Tong "song".
brother
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［gē］
["Guangyun" ancient Russian cut, flat song, see you. ]
(1) The ancient character of "song".
(2) The name given to the elder brother of the same parent or half-brother or half-brother.
(3) The name of the elder brother in the same family.
(4) The name of the elder brother among the relatives.
(5) Respect or nickname for men who are similar to their age.
(6) Specifically refers to the name a woman gives to the man she loves.
(7) The Tang Dynasty often referred to his father as his brother.
(8) Modal particles. Equivalent to "ah" and "huh".
(9) The abbreviation of "Ge Kiln", a famous porcelain kiln in Song Dynasty.
brother

gē
I сущ.
1) старший брат
我三哥不在家 моего третьего старшего брата нет дома
2) почтительное название (обращение) для старшего лица мужского пола своего поколения; уважаемый старший брат
松原吾哥台鉴! уважаемый Сун-юань! (обращение в начале письма)
3) (сокр. вм. 哥比) копейка
4) уст. гросс (12 дюжин)
